TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ValidatorCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Exposes an array of references. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each ValidatorCollection reference is associated with a validation server control contained on the requested page. These controls add themselves to this collection when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Init> event of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object is handled. They remove themselves when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Unload> event of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object is handled. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> class inherits both of these methods from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control> class.
You can access this collection, its methods, and its properties through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.Validators%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. If the tested condition of any validator in this collection fails, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.IsValid%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to `false`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to access the collection through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.Validators%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property and use the <xref:System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to iterate through the values.
[!code-cs[ValidatorCollection_GetEnumerator#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.validato_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[ValidatorCollection_GetEnumerator#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.validato_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Web.UI.IValidator validator) cil managed

Docs.param: The validation server control to add.
Docs.summary: Adds the specified validation server control to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When added to the <xref:System.Web.UI.ValidatorCollection> collection of a <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object through the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.Validators%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.IValidator> implementation takes part in validation. Its <xref:System.Web.UI.IValidator.Validate%2A> method is called together with the <xref:System.Web.UI.IValidator.Validate%2A> methods of all other validators. All validators then share in determining whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> object as a whole is valid.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Add method.
